remarks: The predicate "is a ring homomorphism from ` R ` to ` S ` ." (Contributed by Jeff Madsen, 19-Jun-2010.)
statement:
rnghomval.1 $e |- G = ( 1st ` R ) $.
rnghomval.2 $e |- H = ( 2nd ` R ) $.
rnghomval.3 $e |- X = ran G $.
rnghomval.4 $e |- U = ( GId ` H ) $.
rnghomval.5 $e |- J = ( 1st ` S ) $.
rnghomval.6 $e |- K = ( 2nd ` S ) $.
rnghomval.7 $e |- Y = ran J $.
rnghomval.8 $e |- V = ( GId ` K ) $.
isrngohom $p |- ( ( R e. RingOps /\ S e. RingOps ) -> ( F e. ( R RngHom S ) <-> ( F : X --> Y /\ ( F ` U ) = V /\ A. x e. X A. y e. X ( ( F ` ( x G y ) ) = ( ( F ` x ) J ( F ` y ) ) /\ ( F ` ( x H y ) ) = ( ( F ` x ) K ( F ` y ) ) ) ) ) ) $.
$d F x y $.
$d R x y $.
$d S x y $.
$d X x y $.
$d Y y $.
